data.name: MAD - Mean Average Deviation
data.description:
The Mean Average Deviation (MAD) is a math concept which is taught before Standard Deviation and then mostly forgotten. Like a standard deviation, the MAD is a value which shows the variability or spread for a dataset around the mean.

The steps to calculate the MAD are as follows:

    Determine the average

    For each datapoint determine the distance from the average.

    Sum all of the distances

    Take an average of the sum

For instance for the followings datasets:

(2,2,4,4) has an Average of 3 and a MAD of 1

(1,1,4,6) has an Average of 3 and a MAD of 2

Therefore the data in the second dataset is more spread out.

Write a function to calculate the Mean Average Deviation of a dataset of arbitrary length.
